qa_pairs.question: What sectors are covered by OYAK Group companies, and which of these are explicitly mentioned as part of their industrial holdings alongside their financial and social services?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>The sectors covered by OYAK Group companies include iron and steel, chemistry, cement manufacturing, electricity, and automotive.<cite>[S12]</cite></statement> <statement>The financial and social services provided by OYAK include consumer loans, housing loans, pension system, stock market investment support, supplementary retirement benefits, disability benefits, and death benefits.<cite>[S9][S10][S11]</cite></statement>
qa_pairs.chunk:
Passage 1:
[S1] OYAK


# OYAK



**Ordu Yardımlaşma Kurumu (OYAK)** (English: *Military Solidarity Institution*), is a Turkish charity and military pension fund with around 470,484 members. [S2] The OYAK Holding Investment Subsidiary Group is one of the largest industrial groups in Turkey. [S3] The group was the former owner of ING Oyak Bank, sold to ING Bank in 2007, and the Oypa supermarket chain. [S4] In 2012, it was rated BB+/stable by Standard & Poor's. [S5] The group co-owns car manufacturer Oyak-Renault and steel producer Erdemir. [S6] OYAK Group of Companies added Sagra to its structure in April 2021. [S7] OYAK is on the global coal exit list published by Urgewald because it owns İsken Sugözü power station. [S8] OYAK is a private entity that is subject to Turkish civic and commercial law. [S9] OYAK, also offers services such as consumer loans, housing loans, pension system, stock market investment support to its members. [S10] OYAK provides members with supplementary retirement benefits apart from the official retirement fund, Emekli Sandığı and SSK, to which they are primarily affiliated. [S11] In addition to retirement benefits, OYAK pays disability benefits to members when they become partially or fully disabled, and provides death benefits to the deceased's heirs.ᶜⁱᵗᵃᵗⁱᵒⁿ ⁿᵉᵉᵈᵉᵈ


## Structure


### OYAK Group companies

In the industrial sector, the OYAK Group companies include iron and steel, chemistry, cement manufacturing, electricity and automotive. [S12] * OYAK Mining Metallurgy Group
* OYAK Cement Concrete Paper Group
* OYAK Automotive Logistics Group
* OYAK Finance Group
* OYAK Construction Group
* OYAK Chemical Agriculture Group
* OYAK Energy Group
* OYAK Food Group

### Affiliated companies

Affiliated companies and investments include:

* OYAK Construction (Turkish: *OYAK İnşaat*), founded 1982, in Turkey
* OYAK Yatırım Ortaklığı AŞ: Investment company, part-floated on the Istanbul Stock Exchange as OYAYO.IS
* Oyak-Renault (49% share)
* OYAK Securities (Turkish: *OYAK Yatırım*), founded 1982
* Erdemir, acquired in 2005ᶜⁱᵗᵃᵗⁱᵒⁿ ⁿᵉᵉᵈᵉᵈ
chunk_list:
[S1] OYAK


# OYAK



**Ordu Yardımlaşma Kurumu (OYAK)** (English: *Military Solidarity Institution*), is a Turkish charity and military pension fund with around 470,484 members. [S2] The OYAK Holding Investment Subsidiary Group is one of the largest industrial groups in Turkey. [S3] The group was the former owner of ING Oyak Bank, sold to ING Bank in 2007, and the Oypa supermarket chain. [S4] In 2012, it was rated BB+/stable by Standard & Poor's. [S5] The group co-owns car manufacturer Oyak-Renault and steel producer Erdemir. [S6] OYAK Group of Companies added Sagra to its structure in April 2021. [S7] OYAK is on the global coal exit list published by Urgewald because it owns İsken Sugözü power station. [S8] OYAK is a private entity that is subject to Turkish civic and commercial law. [S9] OYAK, also offers services such as consumer loans, housing loans, pension system, stock market investment support to its members. [S10] OYAK provides members with supplementary retirement benefits apart from the official retirement fund, Emekli Sandığı and SSK, to which they are primarily affiliated. [S11] In addition to retirement benefits, OYAK pays disability benefits to members when they become partially or fully disabled, and provides death benefits to the deceased's heirs.ᶜⁱᵗᵃᵗⁱᵒⁿ ⁿᵉᵉᵈᵉᵈ


## Structure


### OYAK Group companies

In the industrial sector, the OYAK Group companies include iron and steel, chemistry, cement manufacturing, electricity and automotive. [S12] * OYAK Mining Metallurgy Group
* OYAK Cement Concrete Paper Group
* OYAK Automotive Logistics Group
* OYAK Finance Group
* OYAK Construction Group
* OYAK Chemical Agriculture Group
* OYAK Energy Group
* OYAK Food Group

### Affiliated companies

Affiliated companies and investments include:

* OYAK Construction (Turkish: *OYAK İnşaat*), founded 1982, in Turkey
* OYAK Yatırım Ortaklığı AŞ: Investment company, part-floated on the Istanbul Stock Exchange as OYAYO.IS
* Oyak-Renault (49% share)
* OYAK Securities (Turkish: *OYAK Yatırım*), founded 1982
* Erdemir, acquired in 2005ᶜⁱᵗᵃᵗⁱᵒⁿ ⁿᵉᵉᵈᵉᵈ

qa_pairs.question: How does OYAK's role as a military pension fund intersect with its industrial activities, and what specific benefits does it provide to members beyond the official retirement fund?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>OYAK, as a military pension fund, operates alongside its industrial activities through the OYAK Holding Investment Subsidiary Group, which is one of Turkey's largest industrial groups. This dual role allows OYAK to leverage its industrial ventures to support its pension obligations and member services.<cite>[S2][S8]</cite></statement><statement>OYAK provides members with supplementary retirement benefits beyond the official retirement fund (Emekli Sandığı and SSK), including disability benefits for partial or full disability and death benefits for heirs. These services extend beyond standard pension provisions.<cite>[S10][S11]</cite></statement><statement>Additionally, OYAK offers financial services such as consumer loans, housing loans, and stock market investment support, which complement its role as a military pension fund by addressing broader member needs.<cite>[S9]</cite></statement>

[S3] The group was the former owner of ING Oyak Bank, sold to ING Bank in 2007, and the Oypa supermarket chain. [S4] In 2012, it was rated BB+/stable by Standard & Poor's. [S5] The group co-owns car manufacturer Oyak-Renault and steel producer Erdemir. [S6] OYAK Group of Companies added Sagra to its structure in April 2021. [S9] OYAK, also offers services such as consumer loans, housing loans, pension system, stock market investment support to its members. [S10] OYAK provides members with supplementary retirement benefits apart from the official retirement fund, Emekli Sandığı and SSK, to which they are primarily affiliated. [S11] In addition to retirement benefits, OYAK pays disability benefits to members when they become partially or fully disabled, and provides death benefits to the deceased's heirs.ᶜⁱᵗᵃᵗⁱᵒⁿ ⁿᵉᵉᵈᵉᵈ

qa_pairs.question: Which of OYAK's subsidiaries or affiliated companies have been involved in significant transactions, and what were the outcomes of these transactions according to the source?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>OYAK's subsidiary ING Oyak Bank was sold to ING Bank in 2007, and the Oypa supermarket chain was also previously owned by the group.<cite>[S3]</cite></statement> <statement>OYAK added Sagra to its structure in April 2021, indicating a significant transaction involving the acquisition or integration of Sagra.<cite>[S6]</cite></statement> <statement>OYAK co-owns the steel producer Erdemir, which was acquired in 2005, though the specific citation for this acquisition is not explicitly provided in the text.<cite>[S5]</cite></statement>

qa_pairs.question: What environmental concern is associated with OYAK, and which specific entity is linked to this issue through its ownership?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>OYAK is associated with the environmental concern of coal dependency, as it is listed on the global coal exit list published by Urgewald due to its ownership of the İsken Sugözü power station. The specific entity linked to this issue through ownership is the İsken Sugözü power station.<cite>[S7]</cite></statement>
qa_pairs.chunk:
Passage 1:
[S1] OYAK


# OYAK



**Ordu Yardımlaşma Kurumu (OYAK)** (English: *Military Solidarity Institution*), is a Turkish charity and military pension fund with around 470,484 members. [S2] The OYAK Holding Investment Subsidiary Group is one of the largest industrial groups in Turkey. [S3] The group was the former owner of ING Oyak Bank, sold to ING Bank in 2007, and the Oypa supermarket chain. [S4] In 2012, it was rated BB+/stable by Standard & Poor's. [S5] The group co-owns car manufacturer Oyak-Renault and steel producer Erdemir. [S6] OYAK Group of Companies added Sagra to its structure in April 2021. [S7] OYAK is on the global coal exit list published by Urgewald because it owns İsken Sugözü power station. [S8] OYAK is a private entity that is subject to Turkish civic and commercial law. [S9] OYAK, also offers services such as consumer loans, housing loans, pension system, stock market investment support to its members. [S10] OYAK provides members with supplementary retirement benefits apart from the official retirement fund, Emekli Sandığı and SSK, to which they are primarily affiliated. [S11] In addition to retirement benefits, OYAK pays disability benefits to members when they become partially or fully disabled, and provides death benefits to the deceased's heirs.ᶜⁱᵗᵃᵗⁱᵒⁿ ⁿᵉᵉᵈᵉᵈ


## Structure


### OYAK Group companies

* OYAK Energy Group
* OYAK Food Group

qa_pairs.question: How does OYAK's status as a private entity under Turkish law influence its operations, and what types of services does it offer to its members?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>OYAK's status as a private entity under Turkish law influences its operations by subjecting it to Turkish civic and commercial law, allowing it to function within the framework of private sector regulations and responsibilities.<cite>[S8]</cite></statement> <statement>OYAK offers services such as consumer loans, housing loans, pension system support, stock market investment assistance, supplementary retirement benefits, disability benefits, and death benefits to its members.<cite>[S9][S10][S11]</cite></statement>
